titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Gustavus Ferdinand Theel received his M.D. from the Philadelphia University of Medicine and Surgery in 1879. Theel offered diagnosis in person or through a urine sample sent to him through the mail. He treated cases of "self-abuse, gonorrhea, chancre, syphilis, lost manhood, etc."

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of approximately 75 letters from patients addressed to Professor Gustavus Ferdinand Theel written between 1899 and 1901. The letters describe symptoms and request medicine for various physical and psychological problems. Some of the letters have Theel's replies noted on them. Several of the letters are from Theel, on his letterhead. The collection also includes two completed patient questionnaires, with subsections for men and women.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
